ENTITYNAME: Oswald Robert Donaldson, Registered Representative
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: A regulatory action was initiated alleging that Mr. Donaldson took part in unlicensed activity by acting as a broker-dealer in the offer and sales of net operating interest of a corporation in the business of gold mining.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: A Cease and Desist Order was issued by the Department.

ENTITYNAME: Levi Britian Edgecombe, Registered Representative for KMS Financial Services, Inc.
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: NASD alleged that Mr. Edgecombe had engaged in 'selling away' by accepting finders fees for loans made to EMF Corporation.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Mr. Edgecombe was fined $4,500 and was suspended in any capacity for five business days.  He was permitted to resign from KMS.

ENTITYNAME: John Tracy Daley, Registered Representative
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Mr. Daley was accused of misrepresenting the terms and conditions of insurance policies and failure to disclose other relevant information to clients.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Mr. Daley was ordered to cease and desist from engaging in the activities described above and was ordered to pay a civil penalty of $500 to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.

ENTITYNAME: CIGNA Financial Advisors (CFA)
COURTORBODYNAMEANDLOCATION: State of Connecticut Department of Insurance
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The Connecticut Insurance Commissioner found CFA not appropriately licensed with respect to its financial planning activities.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: CFA neither admitted nor denied the allegations and while disagreeing with the Department's interpretation of Connecticut law, CFA agreed to voluntarily cease and desist in order to settle the matter.

ENTITYNAME: John Tracy Daley, Registered Representative
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Mr. Daley was accused of misrepresenting the terms and conditions of insurance policies and failure to disclose other relevant information to clients.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Mr. Daly was ordered to cease and desist from engaging in the activities described above and was ordered to pay a civil penalty of $500 to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.

ENTITYNAME: The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company (Lincoln)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Individual life internal and external replacement policies and procedures were not always consistently followed.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Lincoln signed a Consent Order on March 1, 2007 and agreed to pay an administrative fine of $30,000.

ENTITYNAME: Edgar Ernest Shirley, Registered Representative of Lincoln Financial Advisors
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Mr. Shirley's license was suspended from August 21, 1999 until September 14, 1999 because he failed to provide documentation of completion of courses for continuing education requirements.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: On October 19, 1999, the Continuing Education Advisory Board advised that Mr. Shirley was in compliance.

ENTITYNAME: David Martin Juras, Registered Representative
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Mr. Juras did not renew his Michigan securities license because he was no longer involved in securities sales.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: The state revoked his securities license.

ENTITYNAME: Ronald Joseph Maxfield, Registered Representative for LNC Equity Sales Corporation
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: On December 18, 1990, an application for registration as an agent for Mr. Maxfield was filed with Massachusetts. Mr. Maxfield had previously been terminated by IDS Financial Services because of his involvement in an outside investment.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: On October 15, 1991, the Massachusetts Securities Division issued an order approving Mr. Maxfield's registration with several conditions attached.

ENTITYNAME: Douglas Peter Mikel, Registered Representative for Centennial State Securities
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: A regulatory action was initiated alleging that Mr. Mikel sold securities to two Wyoming residents while his application for registration was pending; that several of the securities sold were not cleared for sale; etc.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Mr. Mikel was given a 30-day suspension by the State of Wyoming.

ENTITYNAME: Barnett Chepenik, Registered Representative of Royal Alliance
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Mr. Chepenik was found in violation of NASD rules of fair practice when he purchased a hot issue controlled by his wife.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Mr. Chepenik received a censure and paid a fine of $4,600.

ENTITYNAME: Randy Paul Siller, Registered Representative for New York Life
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Mr. Siller unlawfully shared, with an unappointed agent, commissions obtained from selling four life insurance policies issued by one issuer.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: $2,500 fine imposed on Mr. Siller.

ENTITYNAME: CIGNA Financial Advisors (CFA)
COURTORBODYNAMEANDLOCATION: State of Connecticut Department of Insurance
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The Connecticut Insurance Commissioner found CFA not appropriately licensed with respect to its financial planning activities.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: CFA agreed to voluntarily cease and desist in order to settle the matter and applied for a license for Certified Insurance Consultant.

ENTITYNAME: Jerry Wesley Snyder, Registered Representative
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The Ohio Division of Securities issued a Cease and Desist Order against Mr. Snyder prohibiting the sale of unregistered securities.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Mr. Snyder agreed to without admitting liability.

ENTITYNAME: Oswald Robert Donaldson, Registered Representative
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: A regulatory action was initiated alleging that Mr. Donaldson took part in unlicensed activity by acting as a broker-dealer in the offer and sales of net operating interest of a corporation in the business of gold mining.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: A Cease and Desist Order was issued by the Department.

ENTITYNAME: The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: LNL allegedly conducted variable contract business while improperly licensed.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: The proceeding was closed on December 14, 1995 with the payment of a $100,00 fine by Lincoln.

ENTITYNAME: CIGNA Financial Advisors (CFA)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The dealer registration of CFA was suspended for failure to designate a principal in the State of Arkansas.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Upon designating a principal, the registration was reinstated effective July 22, 1986.

ENTITYNAME: The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Connecticut alleged that LNL used advertising materials that did not meet statutory requirements, accepted business from unappointed agents, and paid commissions to unlicensed corporations.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: LNL paid a $9,000 fine on July 29, 1996.

ENTITYNAME: The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company (LNL)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Kentucky alleged several violations including use of non-approved policy forms and filings, accepting business from non-licensed producers, etc.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: LNL paid a $49,950 fine on October 8, 1996.

ENTITYNAME: The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company (LNL)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The allegation was that LNL used variable life advertising prior to submitting it to the Maryland Insurance Administration in violation of CO MAR 31.09.02.03.(E).
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: LNL paid a $2,500 fine on January 31, 2000.

ENTITYNAME: Levi Britian Edgecombe, Registered Representative for KMS Financial Services, Inc.
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: NASD alleged that Mr. Edgecombe had engaged in 'selling away' by accepting finders fees for loans made to EMF Corporation.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Mr. Edgecombe was fined $4,500 and was suspended in any capacity for five business days.  He was permitted to resign from KMS.

ENTITYNAME: Edgar Ernst Shirley, Registered Representative of CIGNA Financial Advisors
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Rhode Island alleged that Mr. Shirley had not completed sufficient courses to satisfy Rhode Island's requirements for continuing education for 1996.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Mr. Shirley was fined $1,400 and was required to make up continuing education credit prior to expiration of license renewal period on December 31, 1998.

ENTITYNAME: Edgar Ernst Shirley, Registered Representative of Lincoln Financial Advisors
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Mr. Shirley's license was suspended from August 21, 1999 until September 4, 1999 because he failed to provide documentation of completion of courses for continuing education requirements.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: On October 19, 1999, the Continuing Education Advisory Board advised that Mr. Shirley was in compliance.

ENTITYNAME: Benjamin Lochard Hartley, Jr., Registered Representative
COURTORBODYNAMEANDLOCATION: State of California (Commissioner of the California Department of Corporation)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The California Commissioner found that Hartley offered securities for sale that were not qualified by the Commissioner nor exempt from qualification.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Mr. Hartley agreed to pay into a Court Approved Trust Fund the amount of $1,350.

ENTITYNAME: Lincoln Financial Advisors (LFA)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: LFA received a notice from the Securities Division of Nevada of a $5,000 civil penalty for not properly registering a branch location in the State of Nevada.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: LFA paid the $5,000 fine.

ENTITYNAME: Lincoln Financial Advisors (LFA)
COURTORBODYNAMEANDLOCATION: State of Connecticut Department of Banking
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The Connecticut Department of Banking alleged that LFA failed to give affected clients prior written notice that a particular office had closed nor did it advise affected clients of the procedure for maintaining or transferring accounts.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: On February 14, 2005, LFA entered into a Stipulation and Consent Order with Connecticut, paid a $1,500 administrative fine, and mailed required documents to affected customers.

ENTITYNAME: The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company (LNL)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Nevada levied a fine against LNL for failure to file its annual certification of advertisement report by the due date of December 31, 2004.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: On November 14, 2005, The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company ('LNL'), an affiliate of the Registrant, signed and submitted to the Nevada Division of Insurance a 'Consent to Fine.'  LNL paid the $500 fine on November 15, 2005.

ENTITYNAME: Lincoln Financial Advisors (LFA)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: A civil penalty was imposed on LFA because in March of 2001, LFA conducted four securities transactions in North Dakota. The agent involved was not registered in North Dakota at the time of the transactions.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: On October 9, 2006, LFA paid a $4,000 civil penalty to the North Dakota Securities Department.

ENTITYNAME: The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company (Lincoln)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Individual life internal and external replacement policies and procedures were not always consistently followed.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Lincoln signed a Consent Order on March 1, 2007 and agreed to pay an administrative fine of $30,000.

ENTITYNAME: The Lincoln National Life Inurance Company (LNL)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Pennsylvania alleged that LNL: 1. failed to use delivery receipts, 2. failed to use life insurance cost disclosure documents, 3. failed to label life illustrations as 'revised' where required, and 4. other regulatory issues.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: On December 4, 2006, a signed consent order was provided to LNL by Pennsylvania.  LNL sent a check for $80,000 to Pennsylvania on December 21, 2006.

ENTITYNAME: John Tracy Daley, Registered Representative
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Mr. Daley was accused of misrepresenting the terms and conditions of insurance policies and failure to disclose other relevant information to clients.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Mr. Daley was ordered to cease and desist from engaging in the activities described above and was ordered to pay a civil penalty of $500 to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.

ENTITYNAME: Lincoln Financial Advisors (LFA)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The Rhode Island Securities Division found LFA in violation of its securities laws because LFA employed two investment adviser representatives who were not properly licensed.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: On March 16, 2007, the Rhode Island Securities Division and LFA entered into a Consent Agreement and LFA paid an Administrative Penalty of $5,000.

ENTITYNAME: The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company (Lincoln)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: During a market conduct exam of Lincoln, North Carolina found that Lincoln failed to comply with statutory requirements relative to underwriting.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: A voluntary settlement was signed on March 22, 2007, and Lincoln agreed to pay a monetary assessment of $25,393.

ENTITYNAME: Richard A. Daniels, Registered Principal of PAS Securities, Inc.
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Mr. Daniels was barred from association with any broker, dealer, municipal securities dealer, investment adviser or investment company.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Barred from the securities industry.

ENTITYNAME: Michael Wayne Proctor, Registered Representative for CIGNA Financial Advisors, Inc.
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: A regulatory action was initiated that alleged Mr. Proctor participated in private securities transactions without prior approval of his broker-dealer.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: The NASD handed down a censure and a fine in the amount of $5,000.  Mr. Proctor was also placed under special supervision for one year.

ENTITYNAME: Thomas Grayson Easterling, Jr.; Gregory B. O'Quin; and Charles Prince, Registered Representatives of LFA
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: An investigation was initiated by the NASD regarding several registered representatives regarding questions raised from a random SEC audit which resulted in deficiencies with respect to closely held stock and registered investment adviser activities.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: The NASD issued a censure and a monetary fine in the amount of $15,000 assessed jointly and severally on the three representatives.  In addition, all three men agreed to requalify as general securities representatives by taking the Series 7 exam again.

ENTITYNAME: Larry Leon Steiner, Registered Representative of Connecticut General
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: A regulatory action was filed by the NASD alleging that Mr. Steiner sold unapproved securities to clients.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Mr. Steiner was censured and paid fines in the amount of $5,000.

ENTITYNAME: Edward Csibi, Registered Representative
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Sometime prior to 1991, a hearing was held at the NASD Cleveland, Ohio office at which time Mr. Csibi was barred for life from association with an NASD member.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Sometime prior to 1991, a hearing was held at the NASD Cleveland, Ohio office at which time Mr. Csibi was barred for life from association with an NASD member.

ENTITYNAME: Franklin Keith Goldstein, Registered Representative of Lincoln Financial Advisors Corp.
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: An arbitration claims was filed by a client alleging that Mr. Goldstein made inappropriate investments and alleged damages of $12,000.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: A settlement of $6,300 was reached with no admission of guilt by Mr. Goldstein.

ENTITYNAME: Stewart John Viets, Registered Representative of CIGNA Securities, Inc.
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Plaintiffs alleged that Mr. Viets used their funds to engage in high risk investments which were inappropriate.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: The claim was settled for an undisclosed amount to avoid the expense and burden of litigation and not as an admission of liability.

ENTITYNAME: Thomas Ralph Hardon, Registered Representative for LNC Equity Sales Corporation
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The NASD alleged that Mr. Hardon violated the NASD's Rules of Fair Practice when he purchased 650 shares of Radiation Care, Inc. through another NASD member without prior approval from his broker dealer.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: The NASD imposed a censure, and fined Mr. Hardon $2,500.

ENTITYNAME: Donald Sterling Hannahs, Registered Representative for CIGNA Financial Advisors, Inc.
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: A regulatory action was filed with the NASD alleging that Mr. Hannahs made an inappropriate recommendation to the client, Polytemp Corp. Profit Sharing Plan and Trust to divest $100,000 of interest from Fidelity Magellan Fund.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: The case was settled for $45,000.

ENTITYNAME: Bronson Cooper Jacoway, Jr., Registered Representative of CIGNA Securities, Inc.
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: In three separate actions, Mr. Jacoway was accused of various violations of securities rules and regulations including a breach of fiduciary duty, fraud, etc.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: In all three cases, a settlement agreement was entered into to avoid the expense and burden of litigation not as an admission of guilt or liability.

ENTITYNAME: Michael Wayne Proctor, Registered Representative for CIGNA Financial Advisors, Inc.
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: A regulatory action was initiated that alleged Mr. Proctor participated in private securities transactions without prior approval of his broker-dealer.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: The NASD handed down a censure and a fine in the amount of $5,000.  Mr. Proctor was also placed under special supervision for one year.

ENTITYNAME: Ernst Charles Edward Ruppert, III, Registered Representative for Royal Alliance
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: An arbitration claim was filed alleging that Mr. Ruppert sold inappropriate limited partnerships to a client and as a result, the client suffered approximately $46,000 in losses.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: A settlement of $39,000 was reached and all charges against Mr. Ruppert were dropped.

ENTITYNAME: Thomas Grayson Easterling, Jr.; Gregory B. O'Quin; and Charles Prince, Registered Representatives of LFA
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: An investigation was initiated by the NASD regarding several registered representatives regarding questions raised from a random SEC audit which resulted in deficiencies with respect to closely held stock and registered investment adviser activities.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: The NASD issued a censure and a monetary fine in the amount of $15,000 assessed jointly and severally on the three representatives.  In addition, all three men agreed to requalify as general securities representatives by taking the Series 7 exam again.

ENTITYNAME: Larry Leon Steiner, Registered Representative of Connecticut General
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: A regulatory action was filed by the NASD alleging that Mr. Steiner sold unapproved securities to clients.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Mr. Steiner was censured and paid fines in the amount of $5,000.

ENTITYNAME: Lincoln Financial Advisors (LFA)
ACTIONTITLE: Letter of Acceptance, Waiver and Consent
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: On July 1, 2005, the NASD notified LFA of its acceptance of a Letter of Acceptance, Waiver and Consent.  The Letter noted violations of NASD Rules 2110 and 3070 and maintenance of adequate written supervisory procedures.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: LFA filed all the requisite disclosures under NASD Rules 2110 and 3070 and prepared written supervisory procedures in compliance with Rule 3070(c). LFA signed the Letter of Acceptance, Waiver and Consent (the 'Letter') and agreed to pay any fines.

ENTITYNAME: Lincoln Financial Advisors (LFA)
ACTIONTITLE: Letter of Acceptance, Waiver and Consent
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The NASD alleged that LFA violated NASD Rules in connection with an agreement between mutual fund complexes and LFA's clearing firms by receiving directed brokerage commission payments.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: On August 5, 2005, LFA submitted to the NASD a Letter of Acceptance, Waiver and Consent, and paid a $950,000 fine on August 29, 2005.

ENTITYNAME: Richard A. Daniels, Registered Principal of PAS Securities, Inc.
COURTORBODYNAMEANDLOCATION: U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Ohio
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Mr. Daniels pled guilty to two counts of using the mail in interstate commerce to sell unregistered securities.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: He was fined $5,000 and placed on probation for five years.

ENTITYNAME: Delaware Service Company, Inc. (DSC)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The SEC found that DSC violated Sections 19(A) and 34(B).
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: On September 18, 2006, Delaware Service Company, Inc. paid a $425,000 fine to the Securities and Exchange Commission.

ENTITYNAME: CIGNA Financial Advisors (CFA)
COURTORBODYNAMEANDLOCATION: State of Connecticut Department of Insurance
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The Connecticut Insurance Commissioner found CFA not appropriately licensed with respect to its financial planning activities.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: CFA agreed to voluntarily cease and desist in order to settle the matter and applied for a license for Certified Insurance Consultant.

ENTITYNAME: Richard A. Daniels, Registered Principal of PAS Securities, Inc.
COURTORBODYNAMEANDLOCATION: U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Ohio
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Mr. Daniels was enjoined from further violations of certain Sections of the Securities Act and the Securities Exchange Act.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Permanent injunction.

ENTITYNAME: Delaware Service Company, Inc. (DSC)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The SEC found that DSC violated Sections 19(A) and 34(B).
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: On September 18, 2006, Delaware Service Company, Inc. paid a $425,000 fine to the Securities and Exchange Commission.

ENTITYNAME: Lincoln Independent Limited ('LIL'), an indirect subsidiary of Lincoln National Corporation
COURTORBODYNAMEANDLOCATION: Personal Investment Authority ('RIA'), a United Kingdom SRO
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The PIA alleged that LIL failed to take all reasonable steps to carry out its pension review in accordance with PIA standards and failed to adequately monitor the conduct of its review with a view of ensuring compliance with its procedures and its own com
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: The proceeding was closed on July 8, 1997 with payment of LIL of a 75,000 pound fine and 10,000 pounds in additional costs.

ENTITYNAME: The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company (LNL)
COURTORBODYNAMEANDLOCATION: Commissioner of Insurance of Puerto Rico
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: An Administrative Order was issued against LNL which alleged violation of the Insurance Code of Puerto Rico. The Order stated that LNL was not maintaining the required investment in Puerto Rico securities.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: The proceeding was closed on October 24, 1988 with payment by LNL of a $500 fine.

ENTITYNAME: CIGNA Financial Advisors (CFA)
COURTORBODYNAMEANDLOCATION: State of Connecticut Department of Insurance
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The Connecticut Insurance Commissioner found CFA not appropriately licensed with respect to its financial planning activities.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: CFA agreed to voluntarily cease and desist in order to settle the matter and applied for a license for Certified Insurance Consultant.

ENTITYNAME: The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company (LNL)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: On January 30, 2003, he Illinois Department of Insurance signed a stipulation and consent order with respect to issues identified in connection with its market conduct examination of LNL.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Lincoln Life complied with the terms of the order in a response letter dated March 14, 2003.  In addition, the $5,000 penalty was enclosed with the letter.

ENTITYNAME: The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company (LNL)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: A fine was levied against LNL because of: 1. Unlicensed individuals acting as agents; 2. Inability to provide certain documentation; and 3. Failure to pay correct interest on claims.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: On July 20, 2006, LNL submitted to Connecticut a 'Complaint, Stipulation and Final Order' and paid a $39,000 fine on July 5, 2006.

ENTITYNAME: CIGNA Financial Advisors (CFA)
COURTORBODYNAMEANDLOCATION: State of Connecticut Department of Insurance
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The Connecticut Insurance Commissioner found CFA not appropriately licensed with respect to its financial planning activities.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: CFA agreed to voluntarily cease and desist in order to settle the matter and applied for a license for Certified Insurance Consultant.

ENTITYNAME: CIGNA Financial Advisors (CFA)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The dealer registration of CFA was suspended for failure to designate a principal in the State of Arkansas.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Upon designating a principal, the registration was reinstated effective July 22, 1986.

ENTITYNAME: American General Capital Management, Inc. (Van Kampen Asset Management Inc.)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The above referenced affiliate was alleged to have aided and abetted violations of section (D) and 13(A)(3), 17(D), 20(A), 34(B) and Rules 17D-1 and 20A-3 of the Investment Company Act of 1940.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: The affiliate consented to an order containing a censure and a requirement that the entity comply with certain undertakings concerning compliance procedures.

ENTITYNAME: Morgan Stanley & Co. Inc.
COURTORBODYNAMEANDLOCATION: United States Court for the District of Columbia
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: SEC alleged that the Firm violated Section 17(B) and Rule 17A-4(J) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 by failing to timely produce email to the commission staff pursuant to commission's investigation re: share allocation practices involving IPOs.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Without admitting or denying the allegations, the Firm consented to an entry of a final judgment in which it was permanently restrained and enjoined from violating above referenced rules. Firm fined $15MM.

ENTITYNAME: American General Capital Management, Inc. (Van Kampen Asset Management Inc.)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The above referenced affiliate was alleged to have aided and abetted violations of section (D) and 13(A)(3), 17(D), 20(A), 34(B) and Rules 17D-1 and 20A-3 of the Investment Company Act of 1940.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: The affiliate consented to an order containing a censure and a requirement that the entity comply with certain undertakings concerning compliance procedures.

ENTITYNAME: Morgan Stanley & Co. Inc.
COURTORBODYNAMEANDLOCATION: Attorney General of the State of New York
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: THE ACTION ALLEGED THAT THE FIRM ENGAGED IN ACTS AND PRACTICES THAT CREATED CONFLICTS OF INTEREST FOR ITS RESEARCH ANALYSTS WITH RESPECT TO INVESTMENT BANKING ACTIVITY.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, MS&CO CONSENTED TO PAY A TOTAL OF $50MM FOR PAST CONDUCT AND $75MM TO FUND INDEPENDENT RESEARCH.

ENTITYNAME: Morgan Stanley & Co. Inc.
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: Firm allegedly transacted business as an investment adviser in Connecticut without registration and employed unregistered investment adviser agents.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Per stipulation and agreement, Firm reviewed and modified supervisory procedures, reimbursed Department $25,000 for investigative costs, and paid $3,700 in past due registration fees.

ENTITYNAME: American General Capital Management, Inc. (Van Kampen Asset Management Inc.)
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The above referenced affiliate was alleged to have aided and abetted violations of section (D) and 13(A)(3), 17(D), 20(A), 34(B) and Rules 17D-1 and 20A-3 of the Investment Company Act of 1940.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: The affiliate consented to an order containing a censure and a requirement that the entity comply with certain undertakings concerning compliance procedures.

ENTITYNAME: Morgan Stanley and Co. Inc.
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: The Firm and several of its employees were alleged to have failed to comply with SOES trading and execution guidelines and the Firm allegedly did not establish, maintain and enforce written supervisory procedures to detect such activity.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: The Firm was censured and fined $50,000 and suspended as a SOES order entry firm and a SOES market maker for a period of 30 days.

ENTITYNAME: Van Kampen Funds Inc.
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: For the period of March 1, 2004 - May 31, 2004, the Firm failed to timely and accurately report 50+ transactions that were eligible for Trace reporting.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Without admitting or denying the allegations, the Firm consented to the described sanctions and to the entry of findings and fined $5,000.

ENTITYNAME: Morgan Stanley & Co. Inc.
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: MSCO allegedly engaged in dishonest and unethical business practice by failing to exercise proper supervision in connection with the purchase and sale of securities and failed to establish and enforce proper supervisory procedures.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Without admitting or denying the allegations, the Firm was censured and fined $5,000.

ENTITYNAME: Morgan Stanley & Co., Inc.
COURTORBODYNAMEANDLOCATION: United States Court for the District of Columbia
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: SEC alleged that the Firm violated Section 17(B) and Rule 17A-4(J) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 by failing to timely produce email to the commission staff pursuant to commission's investigation re: share allocation practices involving IPOs.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Without admitting or denying the allegations, the Firm consented to an entry of a final judgment in which it was permanently restrained and enjoined from violating above referenced rules. Firm fined $15MM.

ENTITYNAME: Morgan Stanley & Co. Inc.
ACTIONDESCRIPTION: SEC brought action against 28 NASDAQ market makers, including MSCO, and 51 individuals alleging improper or undisclosed coordination of price quotes with other broker-dealers and related reporting, recordkeeping and supervisory deficiencies.
DISPOSITIONOFPROCEEDING: Without admitting or denying the allegations, the Firm consented to the entry of a cease and desist order and paid a civil monetary penalty of $350K and disgorgement of $4K.
